When specifically asked on Radio 4's Today programme whether Andy Coulson had offered to resign over the continuing News of the World phone-hacking controversy, David Cameron said: I don't have to go into private conversations. He admitted that Andy Coulson was embarrassed by the speculation. But David Cameron gave him a big vote of confidence by stating that he judged people on whether they were doing a good job in a fair and decent way

in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

At a time when our discourse has become so sharply polarized- at a time when we are far too eager to lay the blame for all that ails the world at the feet of those who happen to think differently than we do- it's important for us to pause for a moment and make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds, he said.
